tool_description: Calculates RF path loss between transmitter and receiver locations using selected propagation models, terrain profiles, and environmental factors.

terrain_profile.description: Elevation profile between TX and RX

atmospheric_conditions.description: Weather conditions: clear, rain, fog, snow

error_messages: Invalid coordinates: Latitude (-90 to 90) and longitude (-180 to 180) out of range.
Invalid frequency: Frequency must be positive and within supported range.
Invalid heights: Antenna heights must be positive values.
Invalid power: Transmitter power must be within reasonable range (-50 to 100 dBm).
Unknown propagation model: Specified model not recognized or supported.
Invalid atmospheric conditions: Must be one of [clear, rain, fog, snow].
Invalid polarization: Must be one of [horizontal, vertical, circular].
Distance too large: TX-RX separation exceeds model validity range.
usage: Provide TX/RX coordinates, frequency, antenna heights, power, and propagation model. Optionally include terrain profile and atmospheric conditions for enhanced accuracy.

distance_km.description: Great circle distance between TX and RX in km

fade_margin_db.description: Additional loss due to atmospheric conditions in dB

line_of_sight.description: Whether path has line of sight clearance
